Reason: The _journalDiskSync configuration option is considered performance-sensitive based on the code context provided. In the journal() method, the _journalDiskSync configuration directly impacts the behavior of the PersistentJournal by enabling or disabling disk synchronization. This operation can have a notable performance variation at the system level, as enabling disk synchronization can introduce performance overhead due to the synchronization process. Therefore, the configuration is classified as performance-sensitive.
